intro: Dicraeia batangensis, commonly known as the Batangensis palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. This palm is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in inflorescences, which are typically found near the base of the leaves. Dicraeia batangensis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
